definition: to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

sentences.english: Restaurant light box production must have characteristics, to attract customers.
sentences.chinese: 餐厅灯箱制作肯定要具有特色，要做到吸引顾客。

sentences.english: The bright colours on the wall caught our attention.
sentences.chinese: 墙壁上鲜艳的颜色吸引了我们的注意力。
穿着有吸引力但不挑逗。

sentences.english: The lines can include transformations and other sexiness.
sentences.chinese: 这些线可以包括转换以及其它吸引眼球的东西。

sentences.english: She carries herself very nicely and attracts all the men.
sentences.chinese: 她体态美好，吸引着所有的男人。

sentences.english: You can use fun ice-cube shapes for drinks, too.
sentences.chinese: 同时，你也可以用些有趣的冰块状给饮料添加吸引力。

sentences.english: it was actually the management training that the company provided. That was the bigger draw.
sentences.chinese: 但它提供了一个管理培训项目的这一点更加吸引我。

sentences.english: The sacred place of the revolution invites a good many visitors.
sentences.chinese: 革命圣地吸引着许许多多的参观者。

sentences.english: Fireflies use their light for attracting mates.
sentences.chinese: 萤火虫用它们的光亮来吸引异性。

sentences.english: B. C. C. I. became a magnet for drug money.
sentences.chinese: 国际信贷银行像一块大磁铁，吸引贩毒的钱。

sentences.english: It can be compared with the periodic abstractor in the continuous dynamics.
sentences.chinese: 这对应于连续动力学系统中的周期吸引子。

sentences.english: Thirty-five is a very attractive age.
sentences.chinese: 三十五是一个很有吸引力的年龄。

sentences.english: The democracy of one dollar one vote is not attractive.
sentences.chinese: “一美元一票”的民主制并不具有吸引力。

sentences.english: King David's statue was made of bronze and it attracted many sculptors .
sentences.chinese: 大卫王的塑像是用青铜铸造的，吸引了无数的雕塑家。

sentences.english: Besides, it will also attract world-renowned "foreign brands" join.
sentences.chinese: 同时，也将吸引国际知名的“洋品牌”加盟。

sentences.english: The Slow Year Movement is becoming increasingly popular.
sentences.chinese: “慢活运动”正在全球吸引越来越多的参与者。

definition: (lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
to come to a place on account of its reputation (idiom); attracted to visit a famous location
to capture (enemy property or personnel)/capture (physics: absorption of subatomic particle by an atom or nucleus)
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
to chase after (a popular person or item)/to pursue/popularity
